item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "That's the problem with drinking, I thought, as I poured myself a drink. If something bad happens you drink in an attempt to forget; if something good happens you drink in order to celebrate; and if nothing happens you drink to make something happen." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "My ambition is handicapped by laziness" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "there are worse things than being alone but it often takes decades to realize this and most often when you do it's too late and there's nothing worse than too late" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out but I'm too tough for him, I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "You have to die a few times before you can really live." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "It was true that I didn’t have much ambition, but there ought to be a place for people without ambition, I mean a better place than the one usually reserved. How in the hell could a man enjoy being awakened at 6:30 a.m. by an alarm clock, leap out of bed, dress, force-feed, shit, piss, brush teeth and hair, and fight traffic to get to a place where essentially you made lots of money for somebody else and were asked to be grateful for the opportunity to do so?" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I couldn't get myself to read the want ads. The thought of sitting in front of a man behind a desk and telling him that I wanted a job, that I was qualified for a job, was too much for me. Frankly, I was horrified by life, at what a man had to do simply in order to eat, sleep, and keep himself clothed. So I stayed in bed and drank. When you drank the world was still out there, but for the moment it didn't have you by the throat." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "if you get married they think you're finished and if you are without a woman they think you're incomplete." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "We are Born like this Into this Into these carefully mad wars Into the sight of broken factory windows of emptiness Into bars where people no longer speak to each other Into fist fights that end as shootings and knifings Born into this Into hospitals which are so expensive that it’s cheaper to die Into lawyers who charge so much it’s cheaper to plead guilty Into a country where the jails are full and the madhouses closed Into a place where the masses elevate fools into rich heroes" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "jan was an excellent fuck...she had a tight pussy and she took it like it was a knife that was killing her." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Erika add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Baby," I said, "I'm a genius but nobody knows it but me." -- Charles Bukowski
